Text:
great... i had first the 64bit installed and not working on many features, and had to downgrade Vista to 32bits... which was horrible...

now everything will work!

You are a total star blubbbla. Using 64 bit Vista on my MacBook was a pretty horrible experience, with not much more than the basic features of the laptop working.

With these drivers, though, everything is up and running beautifully. The MacBook even boots and loads programs faster than my office "built for Vista" PC.
how should I use these? do I just run them in windows or do I need to do it from the mac somehow?
when i try to install the drivers it wont let me. says its a 32bit system and not 64bit. i have vista ultimate and macbook 2.2. what am i doing wrong?

ironmonkeyelite

Did you install a 64bit version of Windows Vista? If not you can't use the drivers.
